title: How to Make Spicy Feta Cheese Dip

methods.name: Whipping Up Spicy Feta Cheese Dip with Banana Peppers

steps.headline: Broil the banana peppers.
steps.description: Line a small baking sheet with foil, and set 1 to 2 banana peppers on it. Set them under a preheated broiler, and allow them to roast for 10 to 15 until they become charred on the outside. Turn the peppers every 5 minutes to ensure that they’re roasted evenly on all sides. You can adjust the number of peppers to suit your tastes. If you don’t want your dip to be very spicy, stick to 1 pepper. If you prefer a spicier dip, use 2. You can substitute any hot peppers that you like for the banana peppers. Jalapenos are a good option. When you’re broiling the peppers, set the rack in the upper third of the oven so there is approximately 8- to 9-inches (20- to 23-cm) between the peppers and the broiling element.

steps.headline: Peel, seed, and chop the peppers.
steps.description: When the peppers are finished roasting, transfer them to a bowl and cover them with a towel so they cool enough that you can handle them. Remove the skins, seeds, and stems, and use a sharp knife to finely chop them. When you’re handling hot peppers, particularly the seeds, it’s a good idea to wear rubber gloves. The oils in the peppers can irritate your skin and eyes.

steps.headline: Combine all of the ingredients except the oil in a food processor.
steps.description: Add the chopped banana peppers, ⅓ pound (151 g) of feta cheese, ⅓ cup (95 g) of Greek yogurt, and 2 teaspoons (10 ml) of cider vinegar to the bowl of a food processor. Process the mixture until it has a thick, fairly smooth texture. Be sure to use plain Greek yogurt for the dip.

steps.headline: Stream in the oil and mix until smooth.
steps.description: Once you’ve processed the pepper mixture, slowly begin to pour 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil into the food processor while you pulse it. Continue to process the mixture until the oil is fully incorporated and the dip is smooth. You can add more or less of the oil to achieve your desired thickness for the dip.

steps.headline: Season and refrigerate the dip before serving.
steps.description: Transfer the dip to a bowl, and add salt and pepper to taste. Cover the dip with plastic wrap, and refrigerate it for at least 1 hour before serving it. The dip pairs well with grilled pitas, crackers, and chopped vegetables.

methods.name: Preparing Spicy Feta Cheese Dip with Dried Spices

steps.headline: Mix all of the ingredients except the feta in a food processor.
steps.description: Add ½ cup (143 g) of plain Greek yogurt, ½ cup (118 ml) of olive oil, 1 clove of minced garlic, 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of lemon juice, 1 tablespoon (8 g) of chili powder, and ½ teaspoon (1 g) of cayenne pepper to the bowl of a food processor. Blend the mixture until it is smooth. You can adjust the amount of chili powder and cayenne pepper to make the dip as spicy as you’d like.

steps.headline: Mix in half of the feta and blend until smooth.
steps.description: When the mixture is smooth, add ½ pound (227 g) of cubed feta cheese to the food processor. Pulse the mixture until it is smooth and well blended.

steps.headline: Blend in more of the feta to achieve your desired consistency.
steps.description: When the first batch of feta is blended into the dip, check the consistency. If it’s not as thick as you’d like, add the remaining ½ pound (227 g) of the cheese and process the dip until the rest of the feta is fully incorporated. You don’t have to add all of the remaining feta cheese to the dip. Add it little by little until the dip is as thick as you’d like.

steps.headline: Season the dip with salt and pepper and refrigerate before serving.
steps.description: When the dip is fully mixed, place it in a bowl. Mix in salt and pepper to taste, and cover the bowl with plastic wrap before refrigerating it for an hour or two. Serve the dip with pita wedges and fresh vegetables. You can serve the dip immediately after making it, but the flavors will deepen and meld if you let it sit in the refrigerator for a couple of hours.

methods.name: Mixing Up Spicy Feta Cheese Dip with Roasted Red Peppers

steps.headline: Combine all the ingredients except the roasted pepper and black pepper in a food processor.
steps.description: Add 1 pound (454 g) of crumbled feta cheese, ½ pound (227 g) of whole milk ricotta, 2 cloves of smashed garlic, ⅓ cup (79 ml) of olive oil, juice from 1 lemon, 1 tablespoon (2 g) of chopped thyme, 1 tablespoon (5 g) of dried oregano, and 1 teaspoon (2 g) of crushed red pepper to the bowl of a food process. Pulse the mixture until it is mostly smooth. You can adjust the amount of crushed red pepper in the dip to make it as spicy as you’d like.

steps.headline: Drain and chop the roasted red pepper.
steps.description: Remove 1 roasted red pepper from the jar, and carefully drain it of excess oil. Next, use a sharp knife to finely chop the pepper. You can use either a homemade or store-bought roasted red pepper.

steps.headline: Transfer the feta mixture to a bowl and fold in the red pepper.
steps.description: Once you’ve diced the red pepper, place the blended feta mixture in a bowl. Use a spatula to carefully fold the red pepper into the dip so it’s evenly distributed.

steps.headline: Season the dip with black pepper and refrigerate until ready to serve.
steps.description: After you’ve folded in the red pepper, add some freshly ground black pepper to taste. You can serve the dip right away, but if you are making it ahead of time, refrigerate it until you are ready to serve it. Serve the dip with pita wedges, olives, vegetables, and crackers.

tyn: Spicy Feta Cheese Dip with Banana Peppers
Spicy Feta Cheese Dip with Dried Spices
Spicy Feta Cheese Dip with Roasted Red Peppers
text: Whipping Up Spicy Feta Cheese Dip with Banana Peppers Broil the banana peppers. Line a small baking sheet with foil, and set 1 to 2 banana peppers on it. Set them under a preheated broiler, and allow them to roast for 10 to 15 until they become charred on the outside. Turn the peppers every 5 minutes to ensure that they’re roasted evenly on all sides. You can adjust the number of peppers to suit your tastes. If you don’t want your dip to be very spicy, stick to 1 pepper. If you prefer a spicier dip, use 2. You can substitute any hot peppers that you like for the banana peppers. Jalapenos are a good option. When you’re broiling the peppers, set the rack in the upper third of the oven so there is approximately 8- to 9-inches (20- to 23-cm) between the peppers and the broiling element. Peel, seed, and chop the peppers. When the peppers are finished roasting, transfer them to a bowl and cover them with a towel so they cool enough that you can handle them. Remove the skins, seeds, and stems, and use a sharp knife to finely chop them. When you’re handling hot peppers, particularly the seeds, it’s a good idea to wear rubber gloves. The oils in the peppers can irritate your skin and eyes. Combine all of the ingredients except the oil in a food processor. Add the chopped banana peppers, ⅓ pound (151 g) of feta cheese, ⅓ cup (95 g) of Greek yogurt, and 2 teaspoons (10 ml) of cider vinegar to the bowl of a food processor. Process the mixture until it has a thick, fairly smooth texture. Be sure to use plain Greek yogurt for the dip. Stream in the oil and mix until smooth. Once you’ve processed the pepper mixture, slowly begin to pour 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil into the food processor while you pulse it. Continue to process the mixture until the oil is fully incorporated and the dip is smooth. You can add more or less of the oil to achieve your desired thickness for the dip. Season and refrigerate the dip before serving. Transfer the dip to a bowl, and add salt and pepper to taste. Cover the dip with plastic wrap, and refrigerate it for at least 1 hour before serving it. The dip pairs well with grilled pitas, crackers, and chopped vegetables. Preparing Spicy Feta Cheese Dip with Dried Spices Mix all of the ingredients except the feta in a food processor. Add ½ cup (143 g) of plain Greek yogurt, ½ cup (118 ml) of olive oil, 1 clove of minced garlic, 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of lemon juice, 1 tablespoon (8 g) of chili powder, and ½ teaspoon (1 g) of cayenne pepper to the bowl of a food processor. Blend the mixture until it is smooth. You can adjust the amount of chili powder and cayenne pepper to make the dip as spicy as you’d like. Mix in half of the feta and blend until smooth. When the mixture is smooth, add ½ pound (227 g) of cubed feta cheese to the food processor. Pulse the mixture until it is smooth and well blended. Blend in more of the feta to achieve your desired consistency. When the first batch of feta is blended into the dip, check the consistency. If it’s not as thick as you’d like, add the remaining ½ pound (227 g) of the cheese and process the dip until the rest of the feta is fully incorporated. You don’t have to add all of the remaining feta cheese to the dip. Add it little by little until the dip is as thick as you’d like. Season the dip with salt and pepper and refrigerate before serving. When the dip is fully mixed, place it in a bowl. Mix in salt and pepper to taste, and cover the bowl with plastic wrap before refrigerating it for an hour or two. Serve the dip with pita wedges and fresh vegetables. You can serve the dip immediately after making it, but the flavors will deepen and meld if you let it sit in the refrigerator for a couple of hours. Mixing Up Spicy Feta Cheese Dip with Roasted Red Peppers Combine all the ingredients except the roasted pepper and black pepper in a food processor. Add 1 pound (454 g) of crumbled feta cheese, ½ pound (227 g) of whole milk ricotta, 2 cloves of smashed garlic, ⅓ cup (79 ml) of olive oil, juice from 1 lemon, 1 tablespoon (2 g) of chopped thyme, 1 tablespoon (5 g) of dried oregano, and 1 teaspoon (2 g) of crushed red pepper to the bowl of a food process. Pulse the mixture until it is mostly smooth. You can adjust the amount of crushed red pepper in the dip to make it as spicy as you’d like. Drain and chop the roasted red pepper. Remove 1 roasted red pepper from the jar, and carefully drain it of excess oil. Next, use a sharp knife to finely chop the pepper. You can use either a homemade or store-bought roasted red pepper. Transfer the feta mixture to a bowl and fold in the red pepper. Once you’ve diced the red pepper, place the blended feta mixture in a bowl. Use a spatula to carefully fold the red pepper into the dip so it’s evenly distributed. Season the dip with black pepper and refrigerate until ready to serve. After you’ve folded in the red pepper, add some freshly ground black pepper to taste. You can serve the dip right away, but if you are making it ahead of time, refrigerate it until you are ready to serve it. Serve the dip with pita wedges, olives, vegetables, and crackers.
sentences: Whipping Up Spicy Feta Cheese Dip with Banana Peppers Broil the banana peppers.
Line a small baking sheet with foil, and set 1 to 2 banana peppers on it.
Set them under a preheated broiler, and allow them to roast for 10 to 15 until they become charred on the outside.
Turn the peppers every 5 minutes to ensure that they’re roasted evenly on all sides.
You can adjust the number of peppers to suit your tastes.
If you don’t want your dip to be very spicy, stick to 1 pepper.
If you prefer a spicier dip, use 2.
You can substitute any hot peppers that you like for the banana peppers.
Jalapenos are a good option.
When you’re broiling the peppers, set the rack in the upper third of the oven so there is approximately 8- to 9-inches (20- to 23-cm) between the peppers and the broiling element.
Peel, seed, and chop the peppers.
When the peppers are finished roasting, transfer them to a bowl and cover them with a towel so they cool enough that you can handle them.
Remove the skins, seeds, and stems, and use a sharp knife to finely chop them.
When you’re handling hot peppers, particularly the seeds, it’s a good idea to wear rubber gloves.
The oils in the peppers can irritate your skin and eyes.
Combine all of the ingredients except the oil in a food processor.
Add the chopped banana peppers, ⅓ pound (151 g) of feta cheese, ⅓ cup (95 g) of Greek yogurt, and 2 teaspoons (10 ml) of cider vinegar to the bowl of a food processor.
Process the mixture until it has a thick, fairly smooth texture.
Be sure to use plain Greek yogurt for the dip.
Stream in the oil and mix until smooth.
Once you’ve processed the pepper mixture, slowly begin to pour 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil into the food processor while you pulse it.
Continue to process the mixture until the oil is fully incorporated and the dip is smooth.
You can add more or less of the oil to achieve your desired thickness for the dip.
Season and refrigerate the dip before serving.
Transfer the dip to a bowl, and add salt and pepper to taste.
Cover the dip with plastic wrap, and refrigerate it for at least 1 hour before serving it.
The dip pairs well with grilled pitas, crackers, and chopped vegetables.
Preparing Spicy Feta Cheese Dip with Dried Spices Mix all of the ingredients except the feta in a food processor.

Add ½ cup (143 g) of plain Greek yogurt, ½ cup (118 ml) of olive oil, 1 clove of minced garlic, 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of lemon juice, 1 tablespoon (8 g) of chili powder, and ½ teaspoon (1 g) of cayenne pepper to the bowl of a food processor.
Blend the mixture until it is smooth.
You can adjust the amount of chili powder and cayenne pepper to make the dip as spicy as you’d like.
Mix in half of the feta and blend until smooth.
When the mixture is smooth, add ½ pound (227 g) of cubed feta cheese to the food processor.
Pulse the mixture until it is smooth and well blended.
Blend in more of the feta to achieve your desired consistency.
When the first batch of feta is blended into the dip, check the consistency.
If it’s not as thick as you’d like, add the remaining ½ pound (227 g) of the cheese and process the dip until the rest of the feta is fully incorporated.
You don’t have to add all of the remaining feta cheese to the dip.
Add it little by little until the dip is as thick as you’d like.
Season the dip with salt and pepper and refrigerate before serving.
When the dip is fully mixed, place it in a bowl.
Mix in salt and pepper to taste, and cover the bowl with plastic wrap before refrigerating it for an hour or two.
Serve the dip with pita wedges and fresh vegetables.
You can serve the dip immediately after making it, but the flavors will deepen and meld if you let it sit in the refrigerator for a couple of hours.
Mixing Up Spicy Feta Cheese Dip with Roasted Red Peppers Combine all the ingredients except the roasted pepper and black pepper in a food processor.

Add 1 pound (454 g) of crumbled feta cheese, ½ pound (227 g) of whole milk ricotta, 2 cloves of smashed garlic, ⅓ cup (79 ml) of olive oil, juice from 1 lemon, 1 tablespoon (2 g) of chopped thyme, 1 tablespoon (5 g) of dried oregano, and 1 teaspoon (2 g) of crushed red pepper to the bowl of a food process.
Pulse the mixture until it is mostly smooth.
You can adjust the amount of crushed red pepper in the dip to make it as spicy as you’d like.
Drain and chop the roasted red pepper.
Remove 1 roasted red pepper from the jar, and carefully drain it of excess oil.
Next, use a sharp knife to finely chop the pepper.
You can use either a homemade or store-bought roasted red pepper.
Transfer the feta mixture to a bowl and fold in the red pepper.
Once you’ve diced the red pepper, place the blended feta mixture in a bowl.
Use a spatula to carefully fold the red pepper into the dip so it’s evenly distributed.
Season the dip with black pepper and refrigerate until ready to serve.
After you’ve folded in the red pepper, add some freshly ground black pepper to taste.
You can serve the dip right away, but if you are making it ahead of time, refrigerate it until you are ready to serve it.
Serve the dip with pita wedges, olives, vegetables, and crackers.
